purpose: Present TutorUp's Terms of Service in a clear, scannable, legally compliant format. Enable users to understand their rights, responsibilities, and platform policies. Must be accessible from registration, footer, and account settings. Legal protection for platform while maintaining user trust.

current_problems: Dense wall of text, poor scannability
No visual hierarchy beyond basic headings
No quick navigation to specific sections
Doesn't feel part of TutorUp brand
No way to highlight important clauses
Last updated date buried in text
ux_flaws: Can't jump to specific section quickly
No sticky TOC for long scrolling
Can't share link to specific section
ui_inconsistencies: Generic card layout, feels like afterthought
No use of brand colors or visual identity
Typography not optimized for long-form reading

design_strategy.visual_identity: Purple (#5B21B6) for headings and accents, cream (#FFF7ED) background for warmth, green (#10B981) for acceptance/confirmation. Legal but approachable. Clean, readable typography with clear hierarchy.
design_strategy.layout_approach: Hero header with last updated date → Table of Contents (sticky on desktop) → Clearly separated sections with numbering → Highlighted important clauses → Contact/help section at bottom → Acceptance confirmation if accessed during registration flow
design_strategy.component_hierarchy: Hero → TOC → Section cards (11 sections) → Important clause callouts → Contact CTA → Back to top button → Optional acceptance footer
design_strategy.illustration_strategy: 1 custom flat illustration: Legal document + checkmarks + trust symbols. Used in hero or empty areas.
design_strategy.mobile_differences: TOC collapses into dropdown menu. Sections stack. Simplified spacing. Sticky 'Accept' button if in registration flow. Hero text smaller.

interactions.toc_navigation: Smooth scroll to section, update active item, scroll margin for fixed header
interactions.section_anchors: Each section has ID, shareable URL (#secao-1), copy link on hover
interactions.back_to_top: Appears after 300px scroll, smooth scroll to top on click
interactions.acceptance_checkbox: Enables 'Accept' button, stores acceptance timestamp in localStorage or backend
interactions.download_pdf: Download pre-generated PDF version of terms
interactions.share: Copy current URL (with section anchor if applicable) to clipboard
interactions.scroll_progress: Optional: thin purple progress bar at top showing reading progress

accessibility.focus_visible: 2px purple-600 outline on all interactive elements
accessibility.keyboard_navigation: Tab through TOC, sections, buttons. Enter to activate. Escape to close bottom sheet.
accessibility.screen_reader: Proper heading hierarchy (h1 → h2), landmark regions (nav, main), ARIA labels on buttons
accessibility.skip_links: Skip to main content link for screen readers
accessibility.color_contrast: WCAG AA compliant (4.5:1 minimum for text)
accessibility.reading_level: Clear, plain language where possible (legal jargon unavoidable but explained)

notes_for_dev: TOC active section: Intersection Observer to detect which section is in viewport, update active item
Scroll progress bar: Track scroll position (scrollY / (scrollHeight - clientHeight) * 100)
Acceptance flow: If accessed via /termos?flow=registration, show acceptance footer
Store acceptance: POST /api/users/accept-terms with timestamp when checkbox checked + button clicked
PDF generation: Pre-generate PDF version, update when terms change, serve static file
Section IDs: Each section has id='secao-{N}' for anchor links
Shareable links: Copy to clipboard with navigator.clipboard.writeText(window.location.href)
Back to top: Show/hide based on scroll position (useState + scroll event listener)
TOC mobile sheet: Use dialog/modal component, trap focus, close on backdrop click or section click
Important callouts: Use consistent styling for legal emphasis (yellow bg, icon, bold text)
Table responsive: On mobile (<768px), convert table to stacked cards with labels
Last updated: Fetch from CMS or hardcode, update date automatically on deploy
legal_compliance: LGPD compliance: Mention data protection, link to privacy policy
Cancellation policy: Clear, upfront, table format for easy understanding
Limitation of liability: Standard intermediary platform language
Acceptance tracking: Log user ID, timestamp, IP, terms version on acceptance
Version control: Track terms version, show 'Updated since your last visit' banner if changed
Explicit consent: Checkbox required, not pre-checked, clear language
future_enhancements: Version history: Show changes between versions (diff view)
Highlighted changes: If terms updated, highlight new/changed sections
Personalized terms: Show only relevant sections based on user role (Parent vs Professor)
Interactive Q&A: FAQ section with common questions about terms
Legal chatbot: AI assistant to explain specific clauses
Acceptance history: Users can view when they accepted which version
Email digest: Send summary of changes when terms update
Comparison tool: Compare old vs new terms side-by-side
